text: {{Infobox writer | name = Lloyd deMause | image = Lloyd deMause.jpg | caption = Lloyd deMause | birth_date = | birth_place = Detroit, Michigan, U.S. | death_date = | occupation = Psychohistorian | nationality = American | imagesize = 180px }} Lloyd deMause (pronounced de-Moss; September 19, 1931 â€“ April 23, 2020) was an American social thinker. He was known for his works in psychohistory. He did graduate work in political science at Columbia University. He became a psychoanalyst afterwards. He was the founder of The Journal of Psychohistory. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American historians Category:American psychologists Category:Writers from Detroit Category:Scientists from Detroit
title: Lloyd deMause
